TunableTuple.name: _service_npc_job
TunableTuple.description: The job for service sim in this situation and the corresponding starting role state for service sim. EX: the job for a maid would be the maid_job.

Tunable.name: role_state
Tunable.description: A role state the sim assigned to the job will perform

Tunable.name: situation_job
Tunable.description: A reference to a SituationJob that can be performed at this Situation.

Tunable.name: fail_on_preroll_execute_failure
Tunable.description: If the preroll execution failed, we consider that there was no preroll done and go to the failure state.

TunableVariant.name: fake_perform_on_preroll_failure
TunableVariant.description: Enable this ONLY if preroll_autonomy is tuned. When enabled, the situation to listen to the interaction pushed by preroll autonomy and check if that interaction succeeded in running. If the interaction failed to run for any reason, the situation will run the service npc's fake_perform_job. Ex: for the mailman, preroll autonomy is tuned so the mailman has to delivery mail. if the delivery mail interaction is pushed, but the mailman cannot route to the mailbox, we will still deliver the mail using the service npc mailman tuning's fake perform job

TunableVariant.name: notification
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, a notification will be displayed when the preroll fails and the fake perform modified some items.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Show a notification to a Sim's player.

Tunable.name: allow_autonomous
Tunable.description: If checked, then this notification will be displayed even if its owning interaction was initiated by autonomy. If unchecked, then the notification is suppressed if the interaction is autonomous.

TunableVariant.name: single
TunableVariant.description: This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a Notification tuning snippet.

If this dialog is using a target sim id to give a conversation type view and this is checked, then the target sim icon will instead be replaced by an anonymous caller.

Tunable.name: play_on_active_sim_only
Tunable.description: If enabled, and audio target is Sim, the audio will only be played on selected Sim. Otherwise it will be played regardless Sim is selected or not. If audio target is Object, always set this to False. Otherwise the audio will never be played. ex. This will be useful for Earbuds where we want to hear the music only when the Sim is selected.

TunableTuple.description: Return all harvestables, i.e. all fruits/flowers parented to plants.

TunableEnum.name: test_event
TunableEnum.description: The event that we want to trigger this instance of the tuned test on. InteractionStart: Triggers when the interaction starts. InteractionComplete: Triggers when the interaction ends. This is best used with a one shot interaction. It will not get called if an interaction is canceled. If you have a Sim parked in an interaction that you can only exit via cancel, you will not hit this. InteractionUpdate: Triggers on a 15 sim minute cadence from the start of the interaction. If the interaction ends before a cycle is up it does not trigger. Do not use this for short interactions as it has a possibility of never getting an update for an interaction.

TunableVariant.name: tns_suppression_group
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the TNS will be considered for suppression. Suppression occurs if the number of notifications in this group that fire exceed the tuned TNS suppression limit.

TunableEnum.name: dialog_response_id_override
TunableEnum.description: The dialog response id for this response that will override the default response id. Make sure this is unique for each response.

TunableList.name: loots

TunableVariant.name: response_command

TunableEnum.name: urgency
TunableEnum.description: Specify the notification's urgency.

TunableEnum.name: visual_type
TunableEnum.description: Specify the notification's visual treatment.

Tunable.name: reference
Tunable.description: A reference to a Notification tuning snippet.

Tunable.name: role_state
Tunable.description: The role state to set on the service sim when enter_state_test passes.

TunableVariant.name: preroll_autonomy
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, we will forcefully run an autonomy request when the service npc first gets spawned on the lot. The tunable specifies tests/settings for how to post process a manual autonomy request on the service npc. EX: preroll autonomy for the maid when she first gets onto the lot has an affordance link that blacklists her from doing the serviceNpc_noMoreWork interaction.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: A tunable to specify tests/settings for how to post process a manual autonomy request on a sim. EX: preroll autonomy for the maid when she first gets onto the lot has an affordance link that blacklists her from doing the serviceNpc_noMoreWork interaction.

Tunable.name: allow_unreachable_destinations
Tunable.description: If checked, autonomy will allow interactions that WILL fail when run because the objects are unreachable. If not checked, autonomy won't even return interactions that have unreachable destinations. Interactions with unreachable destinations will just score really high instead of be tested out. This is checked to true for things like the mailman where we want him to do a failure transition when delivering mail to an unreachable mailbox so it's visible to the player that the mailbox is unroutable.

TunableEnum.name: preroll_priority
TunableEnum.description: The priority of the context of the autonomy roll. Use this if you want the preroll's priority to either be higher or lower because the sim could be running another interaction at the time preroll autonomy ping is run.

TunableEnum.name: preroll_source
TunableEnum.description: The source of the context of the autonomy roll. Whether you want the autonomy roll to pretend like it was autonomy that did the tests for available interactions or have the interaction be tested and run as if it was user directed.

TunableVariant.name: super_affordance_compatibility
TunableVariant.description: This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a AffordanceFilter tuning snippet.

Tunable.name: reference
Tunable.description: A reference to a AffordanceFilter tuning snippet.

TunableVariant.name: start_work_test_and_state
TunableVariant.description: If tuned, the situation will start by going to the ArriveOnLotState, and the service npc won't go into their 'working state' until the tuned test passes. When the test passes, the service npc will go into the work state with the tuned role state. If this is left as None, the service npc will start the situation going to the working state.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: A job state paired when a test for when the situation should transition to that job state

TunableTuple.name: enter_state_test
TunableTuple.description: Test for what interaction to listen for. If the Ran interaction test passes, the service sim in situation will transition to the tuned role state.

TunableList.name: affordance_lists
TunableList.description: The Sim must have run either any affordance or have a proxied affordance in Affordances or these Affordance Lists, or an interaction matching one of the tags in this tunable's Tags field.

Tunable.description: A reference to a AffordanceList tuning snippet.

TunableList.name: affordances
TunableList.description: The Sim must have run either any affordance or have a proxied affordance in this list or Affordance Lists, or an interaction matching one of the tags in this tunable's Tags field.

Tunable.name: consider_all_cancelled_as_failure
Tunable.description: If True, test will consider the interaction outcome to be Failure if canceled for any reason. If this box is checked and consider_user_cancelled_as_failure is not checked, user cancel's will still be treated as failures.

Tunable.name: consider_user_cancelled_as_failure
Tunable.description: If True, test will consider the interaction outcome to be Failure if canceled by the user.

TunableVariant.name: interaction_outcome
TunableVariant.description: The interaction's outcome must match the outcome tuned here to pass this test.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: This is the role the sim in question should be to pass.

TunableList.name: skill_tags
TunableList.description: Skill tags to check against skill attached to the interaction, determined by if the interaction identifies it in skill loot data, or if it is an associated skill in the outcome. If you are setting this and are not using affordances or lists for filtering, you probably want to ensure that you set interaction tags that are more or equally restrictive to either one of Interaction_Super or Interaction_Mixer. And do not use Interaction_All, unless you really want to trigger for both mixers and super interactions.

TunableList.name: tags
TunableList.description: The Sim must have run either an interaction matching one of these Tags or an affordance from the list of Affordances in this tunable.

TunableTuple.name: target_filters
TunableTuple.description: Restrictions on the target of this interaction.

TunableVariant.name: object_states
TunableVariant.description: Limit test success only to target objects that are in certain states

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: This option tests crafted item's tags against a list of possible tags.

Tunable.name: definition
Tunable.description: The object must have this definition.

TunableTuple.name: tag
TunableTuple.description: The object must have this tag.

TunableList.name: tag_set
TunableList.description: The tag of objects we want to test ownership of

TunableEnum.description: What tag to test for

TunableEnum.name: test_type
TunableEnum.description: How to test the tags in the tag set against the objects on the lot.

Tunable.description: What state to test for.

TunableEnum.name: test_type
TunableEnum.description: How to test the states in the state set against the objects in the inventory.

TunableVariant.name: object_tags
TunableVariant.description: Object tags for limiting test success to a subset of target objects.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Target object tags and how they are tested.

TunableList.name: tag_set
TunableList.description: A set of tags to test the target object for.

TunableEnum.description: A tag to test the target object for.

TunableEnum.name: test_type
TunableEnum.description: How to test the tags in the tag set against the target object.

TunableEnum.name: test_event
TunableEnum.description: The event that we want to trigger this instance of the tuned test on. InteractionStart: Triggers when the interaction starts. InteractionComplete: Triggers when the interaction ends. This is best used with a one shot interaction. It will not get called if an interaction is canceled. If you have a Sim parked in an interaction that you can only exit via cancel, you will not hit this. InteractionUpdate: Triggers on a 15 sim minute cadence from the start of the interaction. If the interaction ends before a cycle is up it does not trigger. Do not use this for short interactions as it has a possibility of never getting an update for an interaction.

Tunable.name: role_state
Tunable.description: The role state to set on the service sim when enter_state_test passes.
